page.title: 06LONG STRATTON VILLAGE
page.content: Long Stratton has acted as a centre for the surrounding rural area since early mediaeval times. the South Norfolk District Offices stand on the very site of the village settlement established by the Romans in the 1st. century A.D. The centre of the present village is formed by timber framed houses, many dating from the 16th. and 17th. centuries. These properties reflected the agricultural prosperity which the village shared with the surrounding countryside. The Georgian Manor House unfortunately fell into disrepair and gave way to residential development. However, its Ice House still remains and can be seen at the northern end of the shopping precint. It is now a listed ancient memorial.
